embeds.title: Vent Steam
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Apply 2 (3) **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.
[ **Socket** ]
[ **Socket** ]

messages.content: love this card
since this is a setup card it goes great with a lot of setup gems
although strength is the most direct synergy
guardian vented :fluflushed:
Simple but effective way to apply vuln
is this an among us reference???

All jokes aside nice card, this really like having other damage support with it like strength, shivs, and oddly enough I like putting garnet in here. Garnet feels bad almost everywhere else since it only lasts that turn.
btw this card was buffed lmao, it now targets all enemies
honestly I don't think it needed that. I think it was fine single target.
why
it did not need it

honestly most cards on guardian are fine other than a few stand-outs, my personal opinion is that defensive stance as a whole is a little too strong and could use a bit less block and that is really the only major change I would make to guardian
ask mwalls

One of the two main ways to apply vulnerable for guardian, alongside the uncommon gem garnet. I find vent steam can be fairly awkward without the right setup around it. As a 1 cost skill that only applies vulnerable, you really need to draw this alongside other attacks for it to have an impact during the turn (though applying vulnerable for later turns is still effective). There are plenty of times where I draw this and realize that I can't afford to spend energy on it because I need to deploy powers or block instead, or that I need to frontload damage, and would deal more this turn without casting the vent steam. Getting the 4th energy (and getting past act 1 where this card is atrocious against gremlin nob and tri-sentries) helps it's viability immensely. It also gets much better when you have a consistent statis setup going, letting you cast more cards in a turn, which makes the vulnerable far more impactful. 

I highly recommend socketing frontload based gems into this card to ease some of the awkwardness, as it mostly functions as a temporary form of linear scaling. Amber, Aquamarien, fragmented gem, amethyst, and citrine all pair well to make this have more immediate impact. On the flip side, you can lean hard into the setup potential of this card, and put in ruby, quartz, or garnet (and fragmented gem again) and make it into more of a burst damage tool. It's not my preferred way to socket this, but It can be effective, and sometimes you need to, or it makes sense if you have a particularly strong burst damage deck.

In an ideal world, I would just take 2 garnets instead of this and have a leaner deck, or I would have most of my damage coming from multiple copies of floating orbs and not need vulnerable in my run, but I have had good experiences with vent steam. Gems are tough to compete with, because they can tuck away so naturally and condense their value, but garnet is uncommon, and you really want 2 to apply the effect consistently.

Upgrade is notably quite good, that extra stack of vulnerable can be enough to keep it near permanently applied, especially if you are using reroute/recover to loop cards through stasis, or have enough exhausting cards/stasis slots to really thin your deck down. If this card is getting buffed, I don't really think it needs it, I would say that this is in a very good place balance wise right now. I suppose it does make sense from a flavor standpoint for vented steam to hit all of the enemies though.
eh? it’s only terrible against sencheese
nob is just damage rushing, it’s fine there
you usually want to play 10 brace and 1 skill on nob’s second turn so he hits 11 to get 20 block anyway

Generally your hoping to get vulnerable for free with garnet but a common source of vulnerable with 2 gem slots can never be bad and so your able to put vulnerable into guardian decks consistently thanks to this card. It also goes without saying that this card fits very well into gem cannon decks; to the point where you might acutally want 2 vent steams.
with stasis vulnerable is easier to use on guardian too since you can store it for a specific turn to maximize its value, rather then letting the card pass without playing it.
gem cannon decks aren't really a thing. You don't build around gem cannon. You just take gems and 1 tap 80% of fights.

In the same way that I wouldn't consider virus a deck type. You don't build your deck around it, it's OP enough to where it doesn't need support, or for gem cannon's case it doesn't really benefit from support much other than strength and vulnerability.
I'd say a "floating orbs deck" since it activated under a condition you have to meet, but gem cannon you just click. There isn't really any complexity to it.
fair by gem cannon decks I really just mean decks that use gem cannon as their strongest card.
Bad card: costs energy, doesn't draw a card, and doesn't help with my primary late game plan since 1.5 * infinity is still just infinity
Well that’s about what I expected
I also don’t understand why giga bean got changed
Even without debuff reduction or artifact it’s a good finisher
I think he wants to make it the card to artifact in that fierce bash is to accelerate

messages.content: -2 dex is really not much, tbh I think that is going to be a very strong card.
the two stated guardian changes I think are unnecessary and takes cards that are (arguably) niche and makes them a LOT better when I don't think they needed to be.
I think <ancient construct> needs some love, and <incinerate> could lose a bit of its value.

embeds.title: Incinerate
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 9 (10) damage.
**Accelerate** (twice).
[ **Socket** ]

messages.content: incinerate is easy. On upgrade instead of accelerating twice just give it the 2nd socket (and keep the +1 damage)
It's pretty good in the earlygame and it scales way too well into the late game for a common, even if you don't put much effort into it. Now you'll have to put some effort into it.

as for construct, I feel like artifact just doesn't fit on guardian. Temp debuff removal is an almost completely unique mechanic to guardian (hermit uses it in one card) and it is very similar to artifact. I don't think both are necessary and temp debuffs are much cooler to me so I'd say maybe construct interact with that instead of artifact.

Maybe make it

3 cost rare power

At the end (and the start) of your turn, reduce all debuffs by one.
Upgrade is niche since it doesn't effect temp debuffs, but it does better against debuffs applied by enemies like weak frail vuln hex etc
those are the two cards I would've wanted to see changed the most.

actually I have a card idea

Active Infusion
1(0) cost uncommon power
all unsocketed gems are socketed into a random card for this combat.
Might be too niche but a way to mitigate the downside of unsocketed gems at the cost of possibly being a curse later sounds cool to me.
